dt: {bc}to settle or decide by choice of alternatives or possibilities

dt.t: trying to {wi}determine{/wi} the best time to go

dt: {bc}to fix the form, position, or character of beforehand {bc}{sx|ordain||}

dt.t: the extent to which genetics {wi}determines{/wi} one's personality

dt: {bc}to put or set an end to {bc}{sx|terminate||}
{bc}to find out or come to a decision about by investigation, reasoning, or calculation
{bc}to come to an end or become void

pt: {sc}decide{/sc} {sc}determine{/sc} {sc}settle{/sc} {sc}rule{/sc} {sc}resolve{/sc} mean to come or cause to come to a conclusion. {sc}decide{/sc} implies previous consideration of a matter causing doubt, wavering, debate, or controversy.
{sc}determine{/sc} implies fixing the identity, character, scope, or direction of something.
{sc}settle{/sc} implies a decision reached by someone with power to end all dispute or uncertainty.

pt.t: the dean's decision {it}settled{/it} the campus alcohol policy

pt: {sc}rule{/sc} implies a determination by judicial or administrative authority.

pt.t: the judge {it}ruled{/it} that the evidence was inadmissible

pt: {sc}resolve{/sc} implies an expressed or clear decision or determination to do or refrain from doing something.

{sc}discover{/sc} {sc}ascertain{/sc} {sc}determine{/sc} {sc}unearth{/sc} {sc}learn{/sc} mean to find out what one did not previously know. {sc}discover{/sc} may apply to something requiring exploration or investigation or to a chance encounter.
{sc}ascertain{/sc} implies effort to find the facts or the truth proceeding from awareness of ignorance or uncertainty.

pt.t: attempts to {it}ascertain{/it} the population of the region

pt: {sc}determine{/sc} emphasizes the intent to establish the facts definitely or precisely.

pt.t: unable to {it}determine{/it} the origin of the word

pt: {sc}unearth{/sc} implies bringing to light something forgotten or hidden.
{sc}learn{/sc} may imply acquiring knowledge with little effort or conscious intention (as by simply being told) or it may imply study and practice.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}determiner{/it}, from Latin {it}determinare{/it}, from {it}de-{/it} + {it}terminare{/it} to limit, from {it}terminus{/it} boundary, limit {ma}{mat|term:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to settle or decide by choice of alternatives or possibilities
